statements.name: PROC GTESTIT
statements.description: The GTESTIT procedure is a diagnostic tool for testing the installation of SAS/GRAPH software and the configuration of your device. Use the GTESTIT procedure when you want to: â€  o test a new device o test the settings of a device driver that you are developing o identify the colors and some of the SAS/GRAPH lines and fills for your device o review some of your current settings of device parameters and graphics options o test changes in settings of device parameters and graphics options. The GTESTIT procedure produces three pictures that help you determine the configuration of your graphics device and graphics options and parameters.

arguments.name: GOUT=
arguments.description: Specifies the SAS catalog in which to save the graphics output produced by the GTESTIT procedure. If you omit the libref, SAS/GRAPH looks for the catalog in the temporary library called WORK and creates the catalog if it does not exist.

arguments.name: PICTURE=
arguments.description: The GTESTIT procedure produces three pictures that help you determine the configuration of your graphics device and graphics options and parameters.
Shows available colors and patterns, line types, and fills.
Shows the test pattern for continuous drawing ability.
Shows the test pattern for drawing polygons, ellipses, and justified text.
